form.official-title: To make continuing appropriations for certain programs that benefit sportsmen in the event of a lapse in appropriations.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Keeping Public Lands Open Act
.

paragraph.text: units of the National Park System, units of the National Forest System, units of the National Wildlife Refuge System, and other public land—

subparagraph.text: are an integral part of the conservation heritage of the United States;
support jobs and economic activity in communities across the United States, including in many rural areas; and

paragraph.text: it is critical that the public have uninterrupted access to the national treasures referred to in paragraph (1).

section.header: Automatic continuing appropriations for certain covered accounts

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered account means each of the following appropriation accounts:

paragraph.text: Within the Department of the Interior for the Fish and Wildlife Service, within the resource management appropriation, amounts made available for—

subparagraph.text: the activities of the National Wildlife Refuge System; and

paragraph.text: Within the Department of the Interior for the Fish and Wildlife Service, the appropriation for the Migratory Bird Conservation Account.
Within the Department of Agriculture for the Forest Service, within the National Forest System appropriation, amounts made available for—

subparagraph.text: the activities of recreation, heritage, and wilderness; and

paragraph.text: Within the Department of the Interior for the Bureau of Land Management, within the management of land and resources appropriation, amounts made available for—

subparagraph.text: the activities of recreation management, resource protection, and maintenance; and

paragraph.text: Within the Department of the Interior for the National Park Service, the appropriation for the operation of the National Park System.
Within the Department of the Interior for the Fish and Wildlife Service, the appropriation for the North American Wetlands Conservation Fund.

Within the Department of the Interior for the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, within the resource management appropriation, under the activity of general operations, the amounts made available for the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation.
Within the Department of the Interior for the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, the appropriation for land acquisition.
Within the Department of Agriculture for the Forest Service, the appropriation for land acquisition.
Within the Department of the Interior for the Bureau of Land Management, the appropriation for land acquisition.
Within the Department of the Interior for the National Park Service, the appropriation for land acquisition and State assistance.

text.cato:entity: If an appropriations measure for a covered account for a fiscal year is not enacted before the beginning of the applicable fiscal year and a joint resolution making continuing appropriations for the covered account is not in effect, such sums as may be necessary shall be made available without further appropriation to continue any program, project, or activity for which funds were provided from the covered account in the preceding fiscal year.

subsection.text: Appropriations and funds made available under this section for a program, project, or activity funded by a covered account shall be in an amount equal to a pro rata amount of the annual funding provided for the program, project, or activity in the preceding appropriations Act or, in the absence of a regular appropriations Act, a joint resolution making continuing appropriations for the preceding fiscal year.

Appropriations and funds made available, and authority granted, under this section for a program, project, or activity funded by a covered account shall be available for the period beginning with the first day of a lapse in appropriations and ending on the date of enactment of the applicable appropriations Act or a joint resolution making continuing appropriations until the end of the fiscal year, whether or not the Act or resolution provides for the program, project, or activity.
Amounts made available, or authority granted, for a program, project, or activity funded by a covered account for any fiscal year under this Act shall be subject to—

paragraph.text: the terms and conditions imposed with respect to the program, project, or activity for the preceding fiscal year; and
the authority granted for the program, project, or activity funded by the covered account under applicable law.

subsection.text: Expenditures made for a program, project, or activity funded by a covered account for any fiscal year under this Act shall be charged to the applicable covered account on the date of enactment of an appropriations Act or a joint resolution making continuing appropriations until the end of a fiscal year that provides funds for the program, project, or activity for the applicable period.

This section shall not apply to a program, project, or activity funded by a covered account during a fiscal year if any other provision of law (other than a change in authorization of appropriations)—

paragraph.text: makes an appropriation, makes funds available, or grants authority for the program, project, or activity to continue for the applicable period; or

specifically provides that no appropriation shall be made, no funds shall be made available, or no authority shall be granted for the program, project, or activity to continue for the applicable period.
